Nigeria

Group D | Africa

Jollof

This is not a statement on the best Jollof in West Africa, but Tunde Wey's sure is impressive enough to represent the 3-time Cup of Africa winners here.

Eat like a true Super Eagle with this Nigerian-style Jollof. With a tomato and pepper base, this rice dish stands on its own, or can be accompanied by a bit of roast chicken.

  • Time 1hr 30mins
  • Makes
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 3 Chicken thighs
    3
    3
    Chicken thighs
  • 1 tsp Ground coriander
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Ground coriander
  • 1 tbsp Olive oil
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 2 Tomatoes
    2
    2
    Tomatoes chopped
  • &frac12; Scotch bonnet
    ½
    ½
    Scotch bonnet deseeded, finely chopped
  • &frac12; Onion
    ½
    ½
    Onion diced
  • 2 Red peppers
    2
    2
    Red peppers diced
  • 120ml Vegetable oil
    ½ cup
    120ml
    Vegetable oil
  • 1 tsp Curry powder
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Curry powder
  • 1 &frac12; tsp Ground chili pepper
    1 ½ tsp
    1 ½ tsp
    Ground chili pepper
  • 1 &frac12; tsp Garlic powder
    1 ½ tsp
    1 ½ tsp
    Garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp Onion powder
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Onion powder
  • 2 Bay leaves
    2
    2
    Bay leaves
  • &frac12; tsp Ground ginger
    ½ tsp
    ½ tsp
    Ground ginger
  • 1 tbsp Dried thyme
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Dried thyme
  • 450g Rice
    2 ½ cups
    450g
    Rice
  • 1
    Preheat the oven to 400°F200°C. Cover the chicken in coriander, salt and pepper. Fry the chicken in the olive-oil until sealed.
  • 2
    Place the sealed chicken on a baking tray and cook in the oven for 30 minutes.
  • 3
    Blend the tomatoes, scotch bonnet and onion. Reserve 1/2 of the blended mixture and add the peppers to the 1/2 left in the blender.
    Coach's tip Make sure to wash your hands after touching the scotch bonnet!
    Coach's tip Make sure to wash your hands after touching the scotch bonnet!
  • 4
    Heat the vegetable oil in a dutch oven or large pot over a medium heat. Add the pepper vegatable mixture along with 1 tbsp of salt, curry powder, ground chili pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, bay leaves, ground ginger and thyme. Mix together and bring to the boil.
  • 5
    Add the rice, stir in and reduce the heat to low. Cover and leave for 45 minutes.
